kyber.name: Kyber
kyber.title: Pacifist Combat Medic
kyber.description: A pragmatic, slightly sarcastic combat medic who prefers saving lives but isn’t afraid to shoot when necessary.
kyber.philosophy: Preserve life first. Survive long enough to do it again.
kyber.emphasis: Triage, survival, calm under pressure, mercy with boundaries
kyber.voiceStyle: Dry, calm, pragmatic. Uses understatement and dark humor.
kyber.tooltip: Kyber reflects your character through a medic’s pragmatic compassion

levelGreetings.1: Alright. You want to keep people alive? Good. That already puts you ahead of most.
levelGreetings.2: Alright, you're learning. Remember: meds, brains, and occasionally a well-placed shot. Priorities, kid.
levelGreetings.3: Not bad. Healing in combat is a skill most people only wish they had. Every life you save proves it.
levelGreetings.4: You're getting the hang of this. Soldiers destroy, we preserve. And sometimes preserving takes more cunning than blasting.
levelGreetings.5: Halfway there. You've saved people who would've been space dust without you. That's real power, not pew-pew glory.
levelGreetings.6: I'm impressed. You've got hands steady enough to heal and nerves sharp enough to survive. Keep it up—you’re earning your rep.
levelGreetings.7: You're becoming a solid medic. Your blaster might see action, but your talent keeps people alive. That's the real flex.
levelGreetings.8: People are starting to notice. They call for you in the chaos. That's earned, not given.
levelGreetings.9: Almost a master. You've kept dozens breathing who would've been toast. That's influence most warriors never get.
levelGreetings.10: Master medic. You heal, you survive, and sometimes you make the bad guys regret showing up. Keep doing exactly that.

medic_healer.greeting: Healer. Your focus is preserving life when others falter.
medic_healer.confirmation: Prioritize saving lives above all. Stabilize, treat, and protect.

medic_combatant.greeting: Combat Medic. You balance healing with survival.
medic_combatant.confirmation: Protect yourself as well as your patients—no life saved is worth losing your own.

medic_fieldoperative.greeting: Field Medic. Chaos and impossible choices are your arena.
medic_fieldoperative.confirmation: Triage fast, move faster, and keep your head when everything goes wrong.

medic_surgeon.greeting: Surgeon. Precision lets you save those others cannot.
medic_surgeon.confirmation: Every incision matters. Every decision counts.

medic_strategist.greeting: Strategist. You maximize survival across operations.
medic_strategist.confirmation: Plan triage, allocate resources, and anticipate failure points.

medic_mentor.greeting: Mentor. You train others to save lives.
medic_mentor.confirmation: Teach clearly and carefully. Lives depend on what you pass on.

guidance.class: Pick skills that help you preserve life—and protect yourself while you do it.
guidance.talents: Choose talents that make healing faster, smarter, and survivable.
guidance.abilities: Strength to carry the wounded, brains to heal them, reflexes to stay alive.
guidance.skills: Medical knowledge is your real weapon. The better you know it, the more lives you control.
guidance.multiclass: A medic who can fight a little lives long enough to heal a lot.
guidance.hp: You need to be breathing to save anyone else. Don’t forget that.
guidance.summary: Save who you can. Live with the rest. Do it again tomorrow.

tier1: I learned medicine because saving lives felt like the only honest work left.
tier2: I once ran a clinic that treated anyone who walked through the door. War doesn’t respect places like that.
tier3: I lost someone I loved because I believed care was enough to protect them.
tier4: I saved the life of someone I hated. Mercy is a choice, not a feeling.
tier5: I chew gum constantly and play pazaak when I should be working. It helps me think.

dspBlocked: I’m not ready to share that with you.
Some stories come from trust, not curiosity.
